39299976.review: Not sure if I would buy it full price since it is really short, but I really enjoyed the storyline! It is quite dark and resonated with me. It's gay and deep so I mean, what more could I ask for?

39291652.review:
I played this game in three hours.  It's haunted me for two years now.  It might not speak to everyone, but it spoke to me.  I don't think there's any game I've recommended more.  I don't think there's any game I've loved more.

We have a new apple.  For everyone in the world.

38616980.review: We know the devil can only be explainaed as an extraordinary visual novel. It takes three school ages students and throws them into a forest setting where they are forced to deal with problems they are avoiding. This VN is showing these students what they have to deal with for example being gay or being trans. It's very good at handling how people love the same gender and how someone can experience dysphoria without going into textbook definitions and making the game boring. Brilliant story, brilliant visuals and amazing music and sound. 100% recommend <3

38601722.review:
It's been a year since I first discovered this visual novel. Sometimes I'll find myself thinking about it. There's something about it that makes me keep coming back to it. It's not a very long visual novel, nor is it meaningful to me. The religious and LGBT undertones completely flew over my head. 

The thing is, you'll realize there are undertones. Maybe you'll be like me, and they'll fly over your head and leave you thinking about it for months. Maybe you'll have an instant epiphany your first run through like so many people on somethingawful did. Either way, you'll remember this story in all its complexity.

Presentation-wise, it's very good. The music combined with the art makes for a haunting presentation. The dialogue is written like a transcript of a conversation rather than a carefully-checked grammatically correct passage. And just as the store page says, someone always gets left out.

I still have confused feelings about this visual novel, and I probably will for years to come. But it's short and it's worth a read.

38360664.review: Beautiful and complex. This story makes you realize the importance of unity in adversary. Set to a chilling and melancholic background of washed out pictures of the forest and heart-pounding music, We Know the Devil leaves you with many questions, much to interperate, and a feeling of wanting more after every ending.

37995462.review:
Love everything about this game and enjoyed each playthrough just as much as the last. 
Great music, simple art, and a thoughtful story.

37959218.review: I think the concept was lovely and the tone appropriately creepy. Like another reviewer, I felt a lack of connection to the characters and plot due to the vagueness of writing.

37786511.review:
im trans and gay
i want to read every analysis of this game ever cuz it's a piece of art

37751116.review:
Short, but gorgeous. The combination of the disposable camera photo backgrounds, the creepy-cool synth soundtrack, and sometimes vague writing makes this game at once highly eerie and heartfelt.

Also, it made my queer ass cry.

37565871.review:
this is a game that will make you think and question.
if you already question, this is a game that will make you think harder.
this is a game that will make you hurt.
if you already hurt, this is a game that will make you hurt deeply.
i just finished and i am currently crying and wondering what the point of anything is. i would recommend this game to anyone.

i am often disappointed with the experience of visual novels.
this one was short enough to keep me engaged the whole way and poignant enough to make me want more.
the writing is vague and suggestive. you'll be filling in gaps from your imagination and experience. but it is vivid enough to bring those ideas out of you.

i need a 15 hour nap and a hug

37466907.review: its cute, its clever, its creepy. a short game about 3 queer kid at jesus camp discovering their true (beautiful and monstrous) selves.

37463290.review: Few games have managed to make me double over laughing and cry uncontrollably inside the space of 15 minutes. This is one of them.

37333230.review:
The only thing that is bothering me is the writing: it is too vague and short to establish the characters and the plot. 
But, other than that, it's a good game! 
Unfortuantely, the writing in video games, to me, is very important, which is why I wouldn't recommend it

37309338.review:
Ce jeu est certainement l'un (ou le) des visual novels les plus émouvants auxquels j'ai pu jouer. 
Il est aussi drôle, attachant, intéressant, et c'est une très belle ode aux personnes queers. 
Jouez à toutes les routes, même celle qui se cache ;).

37112849.review:
A short but interesting visual novel. The unique art style helps futher the mysterious atmosphere of the setting. The game deals with teenage confusion over sexuality, gender, and social normals but in a borderline horror/supernatural manner. 

Overall, I'd recommend this game, especially on a sale! Just don't come expecting long length or a story that wraps up with a bow. Each ending leaves you to think about and interpret for yourself to some degree.

36910100.review:
Queer church camp visual novel. Its emotional impact may vary based on your own queer church camp experiences. 
I don't like the zero-punctiation structure of the dialogue, but otherwise a very good time.

36694027.review:
great writing, art and music. 
the story is somewhat obscure, all the more to play this if that's your thing.

36641058.review: Someond did this on purpose. And it was good.

39505151.review:
I bought this game, as i do most of my games, on sale for only a few bucks. It is very short so i understand not wanting to pay full price. 

However, this game was an amazing experience and every route left me just a little bit more in love with it. The symbolism, the use of language, and the themes of acceptance and love were beautiful. I fully admit to marathoning this game to get all of the endings (Two blind playthroughs [red + true ending] and then guides to figure out how to get the others and then another true ending). Replaying it was like re-reading an old favorite and finding new details that you missed before.

So, my take is if you can get it on sale: DO IT. If not, either wait for one or just buy it if you don't mind spending ten bucks.

(P.S.: is there a fuck yes option for recommending a game? Cause if so I NEED IT FOR THIS.)
